content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #78724 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
I think this is P-medium or P-high.
It's possible that it's specific to something in the compiler, but there's a good chance this affects other crates as well
I think we should get an MCVE before prioritizing
Well should we prioritize to get more eyeballs on it?
who would look at it? rustdoc is me and guillaume
I can ping guillaume if you want
People looking through issues who want to help out
But yeah, it might make sense to ping T-rustdoc
I don't thing we should ping for every issue
Well, you suggested it :)
touche
I don't remember if we said to remove I-prioritize on T-rustdoc issues :thinking:
yes other teams don't require prioritisation
we agreed to add p-high and ping the team
should we write it down somewhere?
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/triagebot.20I-prioritize/near/209649094
I would like this to be institutional knowledge and not require me to keep telling people 'yes please ping rustdoc or they won't see it'

We could have some kind of triagebot thing that is triggered by the labels T-rustdoc combined with I-prioritize and removes I-prioritize and adds P-high, but we'd have to change triagebot in order to ping the team.
We could record it in Forge, but I doubt people will look there, which defeats the purpose. We could have an Inside Rust blog post too, but not sure how effective or worthwhile that would be.
@Joshua Nelson Do you want me to add P-high and ping? Not sure if this is a regression though
oh right
I think we just shouldn't prioritize it then tbh
since it's not a regession
Should we just do P-medium or should we not prioritize it at all?
i'd say i-nominated and pinging the team is a better option (But that's me)
I'm not sure if rustdoc uses I-nominated though
like I said last time, nominated is useless because we don't have meetings

like these issues that have been nominated for years and I never saw until I was scrolling through issues yesterday https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3AT-rustdoc+label%3AI-nominated
(because I just removed the label: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/53143 and https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/49514)

yeh i know :stuck_out_tongue: just saying nominated doesn't have to imply that there is a meeting to triage them, it is the similar to "waiting on team" where the wait can be infinite (it just makes it consistent with other teams)
I guess I don't see the point :shrug:
if rustdoc doesn't use it, why add the label?

fair enough. I would then simply leave everything as it is, just let's share the "tribal knowledge" to remember to ping either Joshua Nelson of GuillaumeGomez (don't know if he follows zulip) in case something slips through the cracks.
It's not perfect but I'd rather avoid adding further burden on their shoulders about micro-managing things :)

Joshua Nelson said:

if rustdoc doesn't use it, why add the label?

because then we can differentiate between that and other rustdoc issues, p-high could do the same but then members here have to remember what to do for each team

but then members here have to remember what to do for each team

wouldn't they have to do that anyway with I-nominate?
@Joshua Nelson would it help calling the ICE team to help with your mcve requst?
Sure, that would be helpful :) right now the issue is not really actionable unless I first put in a lot of time to see what's actually going wrong
Issue #78724's prioritization request has been removed.
Prioritized as P-medium for now: it seems people are only running into this in compiler docs and it's not catastrophic.
